sueb262 wrote:
> 
>
> So I looked at the link you provided, and that first picture and 
> description ("Naval Officers dirks") looks almost exactly like mine. 
> That's probably what this one is. That description says that they were 
> first issued in the 1880's, so maybe it is just old enough that it had 
> been "handed down" one generation or something (making it an 
> "heirloom"). I didn't see anything that could be considered a hamon, 
> but I also figured I didn't really know what I was looking for/at.
>
> --- In nihontostudy@ <mailto:nihontostudy%40yahoogroups.com>
yahoogroups.com 
> <mailto:nihontostudy%40yahoogroups.com>, <nixe@...> wrote:
> >
> > Sue
> >
> > where are you located? if one of us are in your area we could 
> arrange to see it. The tanto is a Navy officer's dirk, they were made 
> from early 1900's through WWII. Some had hand made blades but most had 
> machine made blades. If you google Japanese Navy Dirk you might see 
> others like yours. Not sure what else you need, let us know
